stem: The triage nurse is assessing victims in a field hospital following a major earthquake. Based on the documentation in the Field Triage Assessment, assign the most appropriate START triage tag to each victim.

tabs.title: Incident Overview
tabs.content:
06:00: Magnitude 7.2 earthquake. Severe structural damage to hospital building. 
06:30: Triage area set up in parking lot. 
07:00: 40+ victims arriving by foot and private vehicle. High-stakes prioritization is necessary.

tabs.title: Field Triage Assessment
tabs.content:
Victim #R (Respirations)P (Perfusion)M (Mental Status)
Victim 142/minPulses weak; CR 4sConfused
Victim 218/minStrong pulse; CR 2sAlert; followed command to walk to area
Victim 3None (Even after airway opened)No pulse detectedUnresponsive
Victim 424/minStrong pulse; CR 2sAlert; follows commands; large leg fracture

tabs.title: Additional Findings
tabs.content:
Victim 1: Open pneumothorax; sucking chest wound. 
Victim 3: Traumatic decapitation; clearly non-viable. 
Victim 4: Closed femur fracture; neurovascularly intact.

rows.text: Victim 2: RR 18/min, Alert, Walked to triage
Victim 4: RR 24/min, Alert, Leg fracture (cannot walk)

rationale.correct: Victim 1 is **Red (Immediate)** due to failing multiple RPM points (RR > 30 and CR > 2s). Victim 2 is **Green (Minor)** as they are a walking wounded. Victim 3 is **Black (Expectant)** because they are non-breathing and non-responsive. Victim 4 is **Yellow (Delayed)** because they pass all RPM criteria (RR < 30, CR < 2s, stable mental status) but have a significant injury (fracture) that prevents walking.
clinicalPearls: In START, 'Walking Wounded' are always GREEN.
A RR over 30 is an automatic RED tag.
If you open the airway and they don't breathe, they are BLACK; don't perform CPR in mass casualty events.

questionTrap.trap: Coding Victim 1 as Yellow because they are 'confused' but awake.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Any failure in RPM (Respirations, Perfusion, OR Mental Status) = Red.

mnemonic.title: 30 - 2 - Can Do
mnemonic.expansion: R: RR over 30. P: Cap refill over 2 seconds. M: Cannot do (commands). ANY TRUE = RED.
